comments.body: One thing that confuses me a little bit is the dependence on the name "connect-file-external.properties." It is hard-coded above as `EXTERNAL_FILE`, but then why do we need it again here? I'm actually wondering if the full lambda generalization is needed. Could this instead be a flag which simply indicates whether rendering of the external config is desired or not? Or perhaps you had additional use cases in mind?

The files happen to be the same, but this actually refers to the test-specific template whereas `EXTERNAL_FILE` refers to the generated file used by the connector. I'll rename the test-specific template file so it's less confusing.
To be honest, I used a lambda to follow the same pattern as the existing `set_configs` method.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +104,108 @@        self.sink.set_configs(lambda node: self.render("connect-standalone.properties", node=node), [self.render("connect-file-sink.properties")])

        self.source.set_external_configs(lambda node: self.render("connect-file-external.properties", node=node))
        self.sink.set_external_configs(lambda node: self.render("connect-file-external.properties", node=node))
